headline: 'Almost Treasonous': Romney Denounces 'Pro-Putin Sentiment' Among Some Republicans
author: Bradley Cortright
sentences:
– Sen. Mitt Romney reacts to pro-Putin sentiments from GOP members and some media outlets: https://t.co/S6ESuaj46b #CNNSOTU pic.twitter.com/ZPDC3bGMgI
— State of the Union (@CNNSotu) February 27, 2022
When asked if former President Donald Trump’s claim that Putin’s invasion of Ukraine is “smart” would fall into the “almost treasonous” category, Romney did not directly answer.

However, he said, “Standing up for freedom is the right thing to do in America, and anything less than that, in my opinion, is unworthy of American support.”
Romney’s comments come after Reps. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.) and Paul Gosar (R-Ariz.) spoke at a white nationalist conference.

He continued, “But how anybody, how anybody in this country which loves freedom can side with Vladimir Putin [who] is an oppressor, a dictator, he kills people, he imprisons his political opponents, he has been an adversary of America at every chance he’s had, it’s unthinkable for me.

And it just makes me ill to see some of these people do that.”
“But of course, they do it because they think it’s shock value, and it’s going to get them more eyeballs and maybe make a little more money for them or their network.
“A lot of those people are changing their stripes as they’re seeing the response of the world, and the political response here in the U.S.,” Romney responded.
During an appearance on CNN’s “State of the Union” Sunday, Romney was asked the “pro-Putin sentiment” among “some corners” of the Republican Party.
Sen. Mitt Romney (R-Utah) believes that positive comments by some Republicans about Russian President Vladimir Putin are bordering on treason.
Nick Fuentes, the organizer of the event, has expressed pro-Putin views and has been labeled a white supremacist by the Department of Justice.
And I’m hopeful that you’re seeing some of those people recognize just how wrong they were,” he added.
Greene later denounced Putin’s invasion of Ukraine and said she did not know about Fuentes’ views.
We are committed to truth and accuracy in all of our journalism.
And it just makes me ill to see some of these people do that."

"It's unthinkable to me.
